text: one admin note is I know a lot of people talk about the dark pool volume and how you don't really get to see the actual volume. There's just an important difference between dark pool, ATS transactions versus transactions that are internalized. They're kind of different things. So with dark pool orders, they still will hit the consolidated tape. It's just delayed. If it's internalized, that will not hit the tape. You're not going to see that. So if orders, if there's heavy internalization of orders, you're not going to see any they'll follow through. And that's one of the problems with GameStop. I actually don't know to what degree the orders are being internalized. And if anybody has good research on that, I genuinely would love to be able to take a look at it. If you have access to it, let me know so that I can take a peek, throw it in the comments below because I'm very interested in that question. Because we know that for GameStop, the off exchange volume is massive. However, if we take a look at the off exchange volume today, it was 47.64. And the 30 day average is 52. So a little bit lighter than that. Now again, the problem with this is we don't actually know of this off exchange volume. How much of it is internalized versus not?
